intro: Achaetogeron chihuahuensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. The plant has a thalloid structure with a dorsiventral leaf-like body, and it lacks true leaves, stems, and roots. Achaetogeron chihuahuensis is well adapted to harsh conditions, demonstrating resilience to drought and extreme temperatures. It plays a minor but ecologically significant role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
